decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.

Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [0410_SK01, 0410_U744_COU001, 0410_U744_COU002, 0410_U744_COU003, 0410_U745_COU001, 0410_U745_COU002, 0410_U745_COU003, 0410_U746_COU001, 0410_U746_COU002, 0410_U746_COU003]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 3 - The premises shall not be open to customers other than between the hours of 0800 and 0030 Sunday to Thursday and 0800 and 0130 Friday and Saturday and at no other times, unless such hours are approved by the local planning authority in respect of any individually defined unit pursuant to this condition. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood, in accordance with DMPD policy DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (adopted March 2016) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 4 - Prior to installation, details of any ventilation and extraction equipment, including any systems to remove odour emissions and suitable deodorising systems, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Any submission shall be accompanied by a noise impact assessment. The ventilation and extraction equipment shall be installed in accordance with the approved details. 
Reason: In the interests of local amenity and visual appearance, and in accordance with DMPD Policy DMS1.

Condition : 5 - Deliveries, loading, unloading or other servicing activities to the front of the Arches in Arches Lane shall only take place between the hours of 07:00 and 12:00 in accordance with the Delivery and Servicing Plan (Ref: 22740501 dated April 2015 by Steer Davies Gleave) approved under application ref. 2015/2319 dated 25th June 2015. Tables and chairs are permitted to be set out in a 3m wide offset area immediately in front of the Arches in accordance with the Transport Statement Addendum (March 2018) approved under application ref. 2018/1658 dated 24th May 2018, provided that a clear zone of a minimum 3m width is maintained at all times to allow for servicing by vans (transit sized or similar) and for use by pedestrians and cyclists.
Reason: In the interest of pedestrian safety, including people who are mobility-impaired or people with disabilities.

Condition : 6 - Prior to occupation of each arch/unit, details of the cycle storage, both long-stay and short-stay for that arch/unit, in accordance with the minimum requirements set out in Table 10.2 of the London Plan for the relevant use, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to the arch/unit being occupied.
Reason: To ensure appropriate provision of cycle facilities for staff and visitors in accordance with London Plan T5.

Condition : 7 - Prior to occupation of any part of the development, an updated Delivery and Servicing Plan (DSP) with reference to the approved DSP ref. 22740501 dated April 2015 by Steer Davies Gleave approved under application ref. 2015/2319 dated 25th June 2015, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The use of the hereby approved development shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved DSP. 
Reason: To ensure suitable vehicular access arrangements are maintained within the development and appropriate provision for the storage and collection of waste/recyclable materials, in accordance with DMPD Policy DMT2 and the Council's 'Refuse and recyclables in developments' SPG.

Condition : 8 - The development hereby approved shall be implemented and operated in accordance with the Sustainability and Energy Statements dated April 2015 approved under application ref. 2015/2319 dated 25th June 2015.
Reason: To ensure the implementation of sustainable design, low carbon development and renewable energy, in accordance with Council policies IS1, IS2 and DMS3.

Condition : 9 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) or any Order revoking, amending and re-enacting the Order, the use of the arches/units hereby approved shall be restricted only for Commercial, Business and Service (Class E) and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in Class E of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification). 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the neighbourhood by ensuring that other uses which could cause a loss of amenity do not commence without prior approval in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework 2021.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sough solutions to the problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We gave made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offered a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE: As Network Rail are the landowner of the viaduct/arch structure, the applicant will be required to obtain business and technical clearance from Network Rail which is crucial to ensure inspections and maintenance of the asset/structure can continue as well as other important Network Rail tasks. The applicant is requested to engage with Network Rail's Asset Protection Team (AssetProtectionLondonSouthEast@networkrail.co.uk) with a view to entering into an Asset Protection Agreement prior to any work commencing.
description: Change of use of Arches 744 (from Sui Generis 'Estate Welfare' to Class E), 745 (from Class F1 'non-residential institution' to Class E) and 746 (from Class B8 'storage' to Class E).
